page.title: 06THE WRITING ON THE WALL
page.content: ARCHIE FISHER AND CAROLINE ADAM FROM THE BBC, RADIO TWEED, CAME TO INTERVIEW US BECAUSE THEY WANTED TO SPEAK TO SOME CHILDREN OF A SMALL VILLAGE SCHOOL. THEY WERE DOING A PROGRAMME ABOUT A SMALL COMMUNITY AND ITS EVERYDAY LIFE. THEY INTERVIEWED SOME OF THE OLD VILLAGERS WHO TOLD WHAT THE SCHOOL AND VILLAGE WERE LIKE WHEN THEY WERE YOUNG. AT THE START OF THIS CENTURY THIS SCHOOL HAD THREE TEACHERS AND OVER A HUNDRED PUPILS BUT NOW THERE IS ONLY ONE TEACHER AND NINE PUPILS. THERE WERE THREE JOINER'S SHOPS AND A BLACKSMITH, NONE OF WHICH NOW REMAIN. FIDDLERS CAME FROM ROUND ABOUT TO PLAY FOR DANCES AT THE SCHOOL. NOW THERE ARE ONLY FOUR CHILDREN IN THE VILLAGE AND MOST PEOPLE ARE ELDERLY SO IT IS VERY QUIET.
